summary: This is an internal email chain from August 10, 2019, forwarding a timeline and information regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Manhattan Correctional Center. It details the discovery of his body, the apparent suicide by hanging, the falsification of guard logs, and key events from his incarceration, including a previous suicide attempt and a mysterious phone call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the email. He was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC and later pronounced dead, with the circumstances suggesting suicide by hanging.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Was Epstein's cellmate at the time of his first reported suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Was Epstein's cellmate who left the cell on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.

connections.description: Were cellmates at MCC when Epstein had his first reported suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.
Were cellmates; Reyes left the cell on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Bureau of Prisons' Manhattan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein on suicide watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch and spoke with a psychologist.

events.title: First suicide attempt
events.description: Epstein's first reported suicide attempt via hanging at 0127 hours while cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione was present. He was then placed on special observation.

events.title: Cellmate leaves, mysterious call
events.description: Cellmate Efrain Reyes leaves, leaving Epstein alone. Later, at 1919 hours, a BOP officer allows Epstein to make a 19-second call on an unsecured, unrecorded line to an unknown person.

events.title: Epstein found dead
events.description: Epstein was discovered unresponsive in his cell at approximately 0633 hours. He was found with a piece of BOP bedding around his neck affixed to his bunk bed. CPR and medical efforts failed, and he was pronounced dead at NY Presbyterian hospital.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019, with an orange BOP bedsheet around his neck tied to his bunk bed.
The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was informed that at least one BOP guard falsified logs regarding mandatory 30-minute rounds on Epstein's cell.
Epstein had made a previous suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, while cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione was present.
On August 9, 2019, the night before his death, Epstein was allowed to make a 19-second phone call on an unsecured and unrecorded line to an unknown recipient.
Video surveillance for the hallway capturing Epstein's cell was reported as 'broken' on August 8, 2019, with no record made; the hard drives were seized by FBI/OIG personnel.
